Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Our vision is to be the universal symbol of trust, bringing consumers and businesses together through reviews. We are well on our way — but there’s still an exciting journey ahead. Join us at the heart of trust.

As part of the MLOps team, you’ll work closely with data scientists, software engineers, and other stakeholders to bring machine learning models to life—ensuring they’re deployed, maintained, and monitored efficiently in production. You’ll have the opportunity to improve model performance and infrastructure, all while contributing to Trustpilot’s AI-based solutions.

What You’ll Be Doing


Model Deployment: Collaborate with data scientists to take machine learning models from development to production, ensuring quality work and scalability.
Build Pipelines: Develop and maintain data and model pipelines, integrating seamlessly with our existing systems to support reliable, efficient workflows.
CI/CD for ML: Design and implement continuous integration and delivery pipelines to streamline the deployment of machine learning models.
Model Monitoring: Help monitor the performance of machine learning models post-deployment, ensuring reliability, scalability, and quality over time.
Collaboration: Work with cross-functional teams to design solutions that meet business needs while adhering to best practices in machine learning and software engineering.
Optimize: Continuously improve our infrastructure, ensuring we remain at the forefront of AI model production and delivery.


Who You Are


Solid technical foundation in both machine learning and software engineering.
Experience deploying machine learning models in production environments.
Proficiency in Python and relevant ML libraries (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch, scikit-learn).
Familiarity with cloud platforms like GCP, AWS, or Azure.
Experience with CI/CD pipelines for machine learning (e.g., Vertex AI).
Experience with data processing frameworks and tools, particularly Apache Beam/Dataflow is highly desirable.
Knowledge of monitoring and maintaining models in production.
Proficiency in employing containerization tools, including Docker, to streamline the configuration of deployment settings.
Problem-solving skills with the ability to troubleshoot model and pipeline issues.
Good communication skills, enabling effective collaboration across teams.


What’s In It For You


A range of flexible working options to dedicate time to what matters to you
Competitive compensation package + bonus
25 days holiday per year, with an extra 5 days holiday allocated after your 1 year anniversary (prorated)
Two (paid) volunteering days a year to spend your time giving back to the causes that matter to you and your community
Rich learning and development opportunities are supported through the Trustpilot Academy, LinkedIn Learning, and Blinkist
Comprehensive health package, pension, and full access to Headspace, a popular mindfulness app to promote positive mental health
Paid parental leave
Central office with a laid-back vibe and constant buzz of different languages being spoken everywhere you go It’s complete with a coffee bar, canteen, and table tennis and has a wide variety of refreshments available - you can opt-in for breakfast and lunch at an affordable price
Regular opportunities to connect and get to know your fellow Trusties, including company-wide celebrations and events, ERG activities, and team socials
Opportunity to join the Trustpilot Social Club for a small monthly fee and attend regular social and leisure activities like go-karting, cooking classes, and escape rooms
Employee discounts to restaurants and shops


Still not sure?

We want to be a part of creating a more diverse, equitable, and inclusive world of work for all. We’re excited to hear about your experiences as well as how you will contribute to our working culture. So, even if you don’t feel you don't meet all the requirements, we'd still really like to hear from you!

About Us

Trustpilot began in 2007 with a simple yet powerful idea that is more relevant today than ever — to be the universal symbol of trust, bringing consumers and businesses together through reviews. Trustpilot is open, independent, and impartial — we help consumers make the right choices and businesses to build trust, grow and improve.

Today, we have more than 300 million reviews and 67 million monthly active users across the globe, with 127 billion annual Trustpilot brand impressions, and the numbers keep growing. We have more than 900 employees and we’re headquartered in Copenhagen, with operations in Amsterdam, Denver, Edinburgh, Hamburg, London, Melbourne, Milan and New York.

We’re driven by connection. It’s at the heart of what we do. Our culture keeps things fresh –– it’s built on the relationships we create. We talk, we laugh, we collaborate and we respect each other. We work across borders and cultures to be the universal symbol of trust in an ever-changing world. With vibrant office locations worldwide and over 50 nationalities, we’re proud to be an equal opportunity workplace with diverse perspectives and ideas.

Our purpose to help people and businesses help each other is a tall order, but we keep it real. We’re a great bunch of humans, doing awesome stuff, without fuss or pretense. A successful Trustpilot future is driven by you –– we give you the autonomy to shape a career you can be proud of. If you’re ready to grow, let’s go.

Join us at the heart of trust.


Show more

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Il Gruppo Lynx è specializzato nella progettazione e realizzazione di soluzioni software presente in Italia, Spagna e America Latina con oltre 1.100 risorse ed è da anni partner di primarie realtà internazionali in molti settori di mercato, fra i quali Finance, Energy e Insurance.

I contesti che ci vedono protagonisti sul mercato sono caratterizzati da una forte componente innovativa, come ad esempio l’uso di metodologie quali DevOps, Agile e tecnologie Microservizi, front-end web innovativi, Big Data, Machine Learning, Intelligenza Artificiale e Cyber Security.




Descrizione del lavoro:




Siamo alla ricerca di un Machine Learning Engineer con almeno 3 anni di esperienza nel campo del machine learning e dell'intelligenza artificiale.

Il candidato ideale sarà responsabile della progettazione, sviluppo e implementazione di soluzioni di machine learning su larga scala, collaborando con team interfunzionali per portare i modelli AI dalla fase sperimentale alla produzione.




Responsabilità principali:




Sviluppo e ottimizzazione di modelli di machine learning per applicazioni reali, con particolare attenzione alla scalabilità e alle performance.
Collaborazione con team di data science e ingegneria per integrare soluzioni ML nei sistemi di produzione.
Implementazione e gestione di pipeline ML end-to-end, inclusa l'acquisizione dei dati, il preprocessing, l'addestramento e la distribuzione dei modelli.
Monitoraggio continuo delle performance dei modelli in produzione e ottimizzazione degli stessi per migliorare precisione, velocità e robustezza.
Gestione del ciclo di vita dei modelli di machine learning, compreso il retraining e il deployment continuo (MLOps).
Sperimentazione e implementazione di nuove tecniche e algoritmi di machine learning, inclusi deep learning e reinforcement learning.
Garantire la conformità delle soluzioni AI alle normative e alle best practice in termini di etica e sicurezza dei dati.




Requisiti:




Almeno 3 anni di esperienza come Machine Learning Engineer o in ruoli simili.
Eccellente padronanza di Python e delle principali librerie di machine learning come scikit-learn, TensorFlow, PyTorch.
Esperienza con pipeline di machine learning e tool di MLOps (ad es. MLflow, Kubeflow o altri).
Conoscenza approfondita di tecniche di apprendimento supervisionato, non supervisionato e reinforcement learning.
Esperienza nell'ottimizzazione di modelli ML per la produzione su larga scala e nella gestione di modelli in ambienti cloud (AWS, Azure, GCP).
Familiarità con i framework per la gestione di big data (ad es. Spark, Hadoop) e con i database SQL e NoSQL.
Capacità di collaborare efficacemente con data engineer, software engineer e stakeholder di business per integrare le soluzioni AI nei prodotti aziendali.
Competenze in containerizzazione (Docker, Kubernetes) per il deployment scalabile di modelli ML.




Preferenze:




Esperienza con tecniche di deep learning e reti neurali complesse.
Competenza in ottimizzazione di modelli, tuning di iperparametri e tecniche avanzate di cross-validation.
Familiarità con tecniche di apprendimento federato o privacy-preserving machine learning.
Esperienza nell'integrazione di API ML in applicazioni aziendali.




Cosa offriamo:




Un ambiente di lavoro stimolante, con accesso a progetti innovativi e tecnologie all'avanguardia.
Opportunità di crescita professionale in un settore in rapida evoluzione.
Supporto alla formazione continua e partecipazione a conferenze tecniche.
Un pacchetto retributivo competitivo e incentivi in base ai risultati.
Assunzione a tempo indeterminato, stipendio adeguato alle competenze




Inquadramento e retribuzione saranno commisurati alla seniority e alle effettive capacità del candidato.




Sede di lavoro: Milano, in formula ibrida.




Gli interessati a questa posizione possono inviare il proprio CV, dichiarando di concedere l'autorizzazione per il trattamento dei dati personali in base all’art. 13 del D.Lgs n.196/03 e all’art. 13 del GDPR (Regolamento UE 2016/679).

Show more

Cosa offriamo:


  • Un ambiente di lavoro stimolante, con accesso a progetti innovativi e tecnologie all'avanguardia.
  • Opportunità di crescita professionale in un settore in rapida evoluzione.
  • Supporto alla formazione continua e partecipazione a conferenze tecniche.
  • Un pacchetto retributivo competitivo e incentivi in base ai risultati.
  • Assunzione a tempo indeterminato, stipendio adeguato alle competenze


Inquadramento e retribuzione saranno commisurati alla seniority e alle effettive capacità del candidato.


Sede di lavoro: Milano, in formula ibrida.


Gli interessati a questa posizione possono inviare il proprio CV, dichiarando di concedere l'autorizzazione per il trattamento dei dati personali in base all’art. 13 del D.Lgs n.196/03 e all’art. 13 del GDPR (Regolamento UE 2016/679).

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Somos exploradores digitais e visionários tecnológicos. Criativos na resolução de problemas e estrategas com visão de futuro. Magos dos dados e catalisadores da inovação. Pioneiros em IA e artesãos de software. Guardiões cibernéticos e campeões da confiança. Na FC Technology, celebramos a diversidade e estamos entusiasmados por acolher as suas perspetivas únicas.

A FC Technology está, neste momento, a recrutar um Data Scientist para integrar um projeto de um dos nossos clientes.




Serás responsável por:

Desenvolver modelos de machine learning para resolver problemas de negócio.
Extrair e analisar dados com Python e ETL.
Criar dashboards e relatórios em PowerBI.
Colaborar com equipas para transformar dados em insights estratégicos.
Garantir a qualidade e integridade dos dados analisados.







És o talento certo se cumprires os seguintes requisitos:

Sólido conhecimento de Python e processos ETL
Experiência com PowerBI para visualização de dados
Nível de inglês C1 (escrito e falado)




O que oferecemos:

Seguro de saúde;
Budget anual para formação;
Parceria com Paynest (consultoria financeira, salário on-demand e cashback instantâneo);
Trabalho híbrido.

Title: MACHINE LEARNING ENGINEER
Description:
NDT Global is the leading provider of ultra-high-tech diagnostic inspection solutions, advanced data analysis and integrity assessment services for ensuring the safety and longevity of energy-sector infrastructure assets. Recognized as the forerunner in ultrasonic inspection technologies comprising Pulse Echo, Pitch-and-Catch and Phased Array, as well as Acoustic Resonance (ART Scan) methodologies, the company also deploys a range of non-ultrasonic technologies, such as Inertial Measurement Units, with more under development. NDT Global strategically applies its inspection technologies to detect, diagnose and model various types of threat—circumferential or axial cracks, metal loss, geometry, mapping, and more—across diverse classes of assets. By providing predictive, decision-ready insights driven by the world’s most accurate data, NDT Global enables the conditions for asset owners to optimize infrastructure health and drive operational efficiencies while reducing risk and minimizing their carbon footprint




Purpose

The goal of the Machine Learning Engineer is to introduce new solutions based on machine learning, especially deep learning, to improve accuracy and efficiency of data analysis from data preparation, model training and testing to deployment in a productive environment.




Tasks

Applies supervised techniques, mostly deep learning techniques, for solving pattern recognition problems in ultrasound data (images, signals)
Understands and interprets data to come up with optimal feature sets
Prepares datasets to train and validate models
Ensures quality of the developed prototypes by software testing and code reviews
Writes documentation of developed solutions and ensures knowledge transfer




Requirements

Bachelor’s or master's degree in computer science or a related field (PhD preferred)
Relevant work experience more than 1 year, in machine learning, deep learning or similar
Experience working on end-to-end ML projects, from data collection to production-level deployment
Experience with image recognition, object detection, and other computer vision tasks.
Proficiency in Python, TensorFlow/PyTorch, and data manipulation libraries
Be able to read SQL databases
Familiarity with big data tools like Apache Spark for data manipulation is a plus.
Experience with git, git workflows, or contribution on git hub is preferred
Must be proficient in spoken and written English




Benefits

Competitive salary and comprehensive benefits package: Health Insurance, pension Plan, Gym Flex, eyecare, 23 days Annual leave
Flexible & Hybrid working: Our flextime model allows you to design your working day as it suits your needs
We think about the future: Individual training and development opportunities and professional development schemes
Opportunity to work with cutting-edge technologies and make a significant impact on our data strategy
International, intercultural and young working environment.
Great company culture and office environment
Show more

Title: ML / AI Engineer (m/w/d)
Description:
Du brennst für Themen wie AI, Machine Learning und KI-Agenten? Du hast Spaß daran, innovative Lösungen mitzugestalten und als zentrale Schnittstelle zwischen unseren internen Projektteams, Kunden und Sales zu agieren? Als ML Engineer (m/w/d) entwickelst du neue Features, treibst technische Themen aktiv voran und wirkst strategisch an der Ausrichtung und Weiterentwicklung von shopfloorGPT mit – inklusive dem Einsatz von KI-Agenten zur Automatisierung komplexer Abläufe. Klingt spannend? Dann bewirb dich jetzt und werde Teil unseres Teams! 🚀

Dein Profil

Du hast ein abgeschlossenes Studium in Informatik, Software Engineering oder eine vergleichbare Qualifikation.

Du besitzt eine hohe Kommunikationsfähigkeit und kannst komplexe technische Konzepte, wie den Einsatz von KI-Agenten, auch einer non-tech Audience verständlich vermitteln.

Du bringst eine pragmatische, lösungsorientierte Denkweise mit, die dir hilft, auch in stressigen Projektphasen den Überblick zu behalten und das Team zu motivieren.

Du schätzt die enge Zusammenarbeit mit Kunden und internen Teams und zeichnest dich durch eine starke Kundenorientierung aus.

Du hast fundierte Erfahrung in der Softwareentwicklung (Python, Node.js, TypeScript, JavaScript) sowie in der Arbeit an AI-/ML-Projekten und ein großes Interesse an aktuellen Entwicklungen, insbesondere im Bereich KI-Agenten.

Deine Aufgaben

Technische Beratung & Konzeption: Du berätst unsere Kunden zur Umsetzung AI-basierter Lösungen mit shopfloorGPT und unterstützt sie beim Einsatz von KI-Agenten zur Automatisierung komplexer Abläufe.

Feature-Entwicklung: Du entwickelst neue Machine-Learning- und NLP-Features, die Prozesslücken durch KI-Agenten schließen und echten Mehrwert schaffen.

Prototyping & Implementierung: Du erstellst Prototypen, um Kundenanforderungen schnell zu validieren und KI-Lösungen vorzustellen.

Technisches Consulting: Du unterstützt den Vertrieb mit verständlichen technischen Inhalten und fungierst als Experte in Sales Calls, Demos und Konzepten.

Team Enablement: Du erklärst komplexe Themen wie KI-Agenten für unsere internen Teams und stehst bei Rückfragen zur Verfügung.

Strategie & Planung: Du bringst deine Expertise in die Roadmap und strategische Ausrichtung ein, koordinierst Teamaufgaben und stellst reibungslose Abläufe sicher.
Show more

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Job Title: Data Scientist

Location: Berlin

Salary: €60,000 - €70,000




Allegiance Group is seeking a talented and innovative Data Scientist to join a growing analytics team. In this role, you will leverage your expertise in statistical analysis, machine learning, and data visualization to extract insights from complex datasets and drive data-informed decision-making.




Responsibilities:

Analyze large datasets to uncover trends, patterns, and actionable insights that inform business strategies.
Develop and implement predictive models and machine learning algorithms to solve complex business challenges.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define data requirements and establish metrics for success.
Create compelling data visualizations and dashboards to communicate findings to stakeholders.
Conduct exploratory data analysis and perform hypothesis testing to validate assumptions.




Requirements:

Proven experience as a Data Scientist or in a similar analytical role
Proficiency in programming languages such as Python or R, and experience with data manipulation libraries (e.g., Pandas, NumPy)
Strong understanding of statistical analysis, machine learning algorithms, and data modeling techniques
Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI, Matplotlib, Seaborn)
Familiarity with SQL and experience in working with relational databases
Excellent problem-solving skills and a strong analytical mindset




Desirable:

Experience with big data technologies (e.g., Hadoop, Spark)
Knowledge of cloud computing platforms (AWS, GCP, Azure) and their data services
Familiarity with natural language processing (NLP) and text analytics




If you are interested in this exciting opportunity, please APPLY and get in touch with Charlie Bennett @ Allegiance Group

Show more

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Project Description:




We are DXC - a Fortune 500 global IT services leader. In Bulgaria, we are among the largest employers with over 4,000 employees working on the company's entire IT portfolio. We are flexible - we provide everything you need to comfortably work from home, but we also keep our offices open for collaboration, meetings, and building a strong team spirit. We tailor everyone's development path to their individual interests through training and additional certifications.




Our experience and desire to grow, our mission, and our values create an environment where ambitious people become successful at home. At home - in Bulgaria.




Data Scientists are members of the Analytics team in Bulgaria. They work on different Analytics projects to give valuable insights for our clients. Our Data Scientists are working with cutting-edge technologies to deliver solutions that solve major business challenges. Some of these include Machine Learning, Deep Learning, Natural Language Processing, and Computer Vision, using: Python Pandas, NumPy, MatPlotLib, Scikit Learn, OpenCV, TensorFlow, PyTorch, Jypiter, Keras, Caffee, Spark, and others.




Here you will gain hands-on experience working with world-famous brands and Fortune 500 companies in a diverse team where everybody has a lot to contribute with - including yourself! The team is constantly growing with over 180 experts in the field.




As a member of our Data and AI team, your work can inspire change for DXC's highest-profile global customers. We live in a data-driven world where data can be leveraged for reporting & analyses and for data-driven products and applications. Our team has strong experience in Analytics solutions, Data Engineering and Data Science.




Join our Data and AI Team!




Responsibilities




Research and develop statistical learning and machine learning models for data analysis
Assess the effectiveness and accuracy of new data sources and data gathering techniques
Implement statistical or other mathematical methodologies as needed for specific models or analysis
Use predictive modelling to increase and optimize customer experiences, revenue generation, and targeting and other business outcomes
Mine and analyse data from various data sources to drive optimization and improvement of client needs and business strategies
Develop custom data models and algorithms to apply to data sets
Work with a variety of statistical computer languages to manipulate data and draw insights from large data sets




Mandatory Skills Description




Experience with Python programming
Experience with relational databases and SQL development
University degree in Computer Science (preferred in AI), other related areas, or equivalent work experience
Fluent English
Knowledge of data science general: Numpy, pandas, Plotly, shiny
Knowledge of statistical techniques and concepts: Generative AI, regression, properties of distributions, statistical tests, and proper usage, etc.




Nice-to-Have Skills Description




Italian language skills
Knowledge of cloud




Languages:

English: B2 Upper-Intermediate

Show more

Title: AI Data Scientist
Description:
(English version below)




Big Data in Manufacturing GmbH ist ein innovatives Unternehmen, das Softwareprodukte für die metallverarbeitende Branche entwickelt. Unser Portfolio umfasst Lösungen zur Datenerfassung und -management, KI-basierte Datenanalysen sowie KI-gestützte Qualitätskontrolle von Werkstücken.




Zur Verstärkung unseres agilen Teams suchen wir schnellstmöglich einen AI Data Scientist (m/w/d).




Deine Aufgaben:

Entwicklung und Implementierung moderner ML/DL-Modelle zur Optimierung von Produktionsprozessen.
Mitarbeit an der Entwicklung innovativer Lösungen in den Bereichen Big Data, Künstliche Intelligenz und Prozessautomatisierung.
Durchführung von Feature Engineering, Feature Learning und Feature Selection zur Verbesserung der Modellperformance.
Unterstützung bei der Implementierung von Self-Supervised Learning-Modellen und aktiven Lernmodellen (Active Learning).
Arbeiten mit MLOps-Prozessen zur Automatisierung von ML-Workflows und -Modellen.




Dein Profil:

Praktische Erfahrung mit modernen Modellarchitekturen (z. B. Self-Supervised Learning) und aktiven Lernmodellen.
Erfahrung mit Feature Engineering, insbesondere im Bereich Zeitreihendaten ein Vorteil.
Kenntnisse in MLOps und der Verwaltung von Machine-Learning-Pipelines sind ein Plus.
Kenntnisse in der Verarbeitung großer Datenmengen und deren effiziente Handhabung.
Solide Programmiererfahrung in Python. Kenntnisse in gängigen maschinellen Lernprogrammen Bibliotheken/Frameworks wie Scikit-Learn, PyTorch, Keras usw.
Startup-Mentalität mit einem lösungsorientierten, selbstständigen und teamorientierten Arbeitsansatz.
Bereitschaft, in einem 100% Remote-Setup zu arbeiten.
Englisch ist kein Problem




Wir bieten:

Arbeiten in einem innovativen Umfeld mit der Möglichkeit, modernste Technologien einzusetzen.
Flexible Arbeitszeiten und die Möglichkeit, komplett remote zu arbeiten.
Spannende Projekte in einer zukunftsweisenden Branche.
Low Legacy, deine Ideen werden gehört.
Attraktive Vergütung




Haben wir Dein Interesse geweckt? Dann bewirb Dich jetzt und werde Teil unseres Teams!




--- ENGLISH ---




Big Data in Manufacturing GmbH is an innovative company that develops software products for the metalworking industry. Our portfolio includes solutions for data acquisition and management, AI-based data analysis and AI-supported quality control of workpieces.




To strengthen our agile team, we are looking for an AI Data Scientist (m/f/d) as soon as possible.




Your tasks:

Development and implementation of modern ML/DL models for the optimization of production processes.
Collaboration in the development of innovative solutions in the areas of big data, artificial intelligence and process automation
Carrying out feature engineering, feature learning and feature selection to improve model performance
Support in the implementation of self-supervised learning models and active learning models.
Working with MLOps processes to automate ML workflows and models.




Your profile:

Hands-on experience with modern model architectures (e.g. Self-Supervised Learning) and active learning models.
Experience with feature engineering, especially in the area of time series data an advantage.
Knowledge of MLOps and managing machine learning pipelines is a plus.
Knowledge of processing large amounts of data and handling it efficiently.
Solid programming experience in Python. Knowledge of common machine learning libraries/frameworks such as Scikit-Learn, PyTorch, Keras, etc.
Startup mentality with a solution-oriented, independent and team-oriented approach to work.
Willingness to work in a 100% remote setup.
English is not a problem




We offer:

Working in an innovative environment with the opportunity to utilize cutting edge technologies.
Flexible working hours and the option to work completely remotely.
Exciting projects in a forward-thinking industry.
Low legacy, your ideas will be heard.
Attractive remuneration




Have we piqued your interest? Then apply now and become part of our team!

Show more

  • Knowledge of MLOps and managing machine learning pipelines is a plus.

  • Solid programming experience in Python. Knowledge of common machine learning libraries/frameworks such as Scikit-Learn, PyTorch, Keras, etc.
  • Startup mentality with a solution-oriented, independent and team-oriented approach to work.
  • Willingness to work in a 100% remote setup.
  • English is not a problem


We offer:

  • Working in an innovative environment with the opportunity to utilize cutting edge technologies.
  • Flexible working hours and the option to work completely remotely.
  • Exciting projects in a forward-thinking industry.
  • Low legacy, your ideas will be heard.
  • Attractive remuneration


Have we piqued your interest? Then apply now and become part of our team!

Title: R&D - Machine Learning /ML Engineer (Mid)
Description:
EXUS AI Labs, the R&D department of EXUS, is where we design and develop robust and trustworthy AI solutions that allow us to leverage the untapped potential of big data analytics across multiple verticals. For more than 25 years, EXUS has gained substantial experience in managing research activities, from the ideation to the realization phase, taking advantage of a highly professional and diverse team. Currently, EXUS AI Labs coordinates and participates in projects which have received funding under the H2020 Research and Innovation Programme, as well as national funding schemes such as Innovate UK.


Our people constitute the source of inspiration that drives us forward and help us fulfill our purpose of being role models for a better world.

This is your chance to be part of a highly motivated, diverse, and multidisciplinary team, which embraces breakthrough thinking and technology to create software that serves people. We offer a creative, fun, and above all, inspiring working environment that fosters team spirit and promotes the greater good. We are positive and eager to learn and explore. We are committed to our vision.

Our shared Values:

We are transparent and direct
We are positive and fun, never cynical or sarcastic
We are eager to learn and explore
We put the greater good first
We are frugal and we do not waste resources
We are fanatically disciplined, we deliver on our promises

We are EXUS! Are you?


Right now, we have a vacancy for an R&D - Machine Learning /ML Engineer (Mid) . This is a fully remote opportunity. You will join a multidisciplinary team of Engineers, Data Scientists, and innovation management Experts that excel in driving innovation in software engineering, A.I., and data analytics, to foster advances in key sectors such as banking, security, health, finance, creativity, and lifelong learning.

Our department is working on numerous large-scale Research and Innovation Projects in various sectors such as Security (Physical and Digital), Health, and Creativity. Our core competence is around A.I., data analytics, real-time systems engineering, complex event processing, and large-scale cloud implementations.


Your main duties will be:


Technical Project Management (project's effort allocation, task plan, projects' progress overview, participation in calls & meetings).
Projects' Technical specification definition & Architecture Design (technical requirements definition, software architecture design, data flows definition)
Apply Machine Learning algorithms and techniques, build and maintain end-to-end solutions
Statistical analysis and fine-tuning using test results
Collaborate with data scientists and software engineers to build and maintain data and model pipelines.
Provide solutions to any technical-related issues during a project's lifecycle




Requirements


BSc degree in Computer Science, Mathematics or a similar field. An MSc degree will be highly appreciated. 
Proven working experience, 3 to 5 years, on application development project(s). 
Good knowledge of mathematics, probability, statistics, and computational algorithms. 
Proven experience and competence in software engineering and design. 
Good understanding of data structures, data modeling, and software architectures. 
Expertise in data analysis and visualization   
Proven experience in Python 
Familiarity with machine learning frameworks and libraries (e.g., PyTorch, TensorFlow, pandas, scikit-learn). 
Good knowledge of Git 
Experience with REST-API design and implementation 
Working experience in Research / H2020 Projects, will be highly appreciated 



Preferred Skills

Experience in frameworks Django, FLASK or FastAPI
Familiar with SQL databases
Familiarisation with application containers (Docker) and general exposure to continuous integration processes and practices
Familiarization with event-driven processes



General Skills:

Excellent understanding of the English language (both verbal & written)
Strong problem-solving skills and analytical thinking
Team player, self-motivated, constantly seeking new knowledge



Ability to travel (up to 10% of total working time, in European destinations) / Fulfilled military obligations for male candidates



Benefits



At EXUS we help our people to achieve excellent results by creating a work environment that encourages individual and team success.




Fully remote work setup
Competitive salary
Inclusive work environment & Well-being Program
A clear induction program & a mentoring buddy to help you
Private health insurance allowance
Show more

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Job Description

Why Recharge.com

We are the leading one-stop-shop for branded payments, making online recharge possible for anyone, anywhere at any time — whether you or someone you love needs credit for calling, gaming, entertainment or money. This is your chance to join an ambitious scaleup in a state of rapid growth; we’ll push you to develop yourself and help you create a real impact in your role. Put simply: we could write history together.

We won’t bore you with a corporate spiel about how we might be taking on the world of branded payments (spoiler: we are). Instead, we’ll let the numbers speak for themselves: we bring consumers their favourite brands to their fingertips, with over 15,000 products available in every gift card category globally, $70 million in funding (and counting!), 20%+ growth in 2023. We also have a revenue target of €75 million in 2024, we're just getting started with 1.1 million app downloads in 2023, we are counting 5.0+ million active customers, a presence in 180 countries and 25 markets, a team of 150+ employees and 35+ nationalities, and 1 person missing — you.

We’re on the hunt for the hungriest and most passionate talent out there. If at any point your brain screams “I want in!” while you’re reading this, then consider this the sign you’ve been looking for: we want you too.

The role

We’re looking for a talented Data Scientist to join our Business Intelligence Team reporting to Nicolas Arrivé. You will work on improving our day to day business operations. You understand what kind of insights drive the right action. You have great analytical skills and are good at making people understand what needs to get done and why.

The BI team embeds actionable insights into the business teams, and drives commercial success (improving sales, margin and/or efficiency). Automation is also at the heart of our business practices when value can be extracted at scale.

Job requirements

What will I do?

As a Data Scientist you will play a vital part in defining our company strategy and execution across Payment flow, Paid Marketing, Customer base and product strategy.

You are part of the Business Intelligence team and you are the technical expert in modelling, testing and analytical techniques helping us analysing millions of consumer transactions.

You are modelling from scratch or improving existing statistical models aiming (among other things) at: predicting and explaining Churn, predicting and explaining next likely brand/transaction to happen, existing Marketing Mix Models, automating anomaly detection, existing Lifetime Value prediction model and many more core operational predictive processes. You can articulate the pros and cons of a given approach to numerous stakeholders.

You perform ad hoc advanced strategic analyses and turn these into KPIs that are relevant and easy to understand.

You are a de-facto code reviewer for the rest of the team for the code base you are the most proficient with.

You are improving the automation of some of our reporting tools (Tableau server and front end) for the most important views and KPIs the business relies on to make daily or weekly decisions & you are coaching and mentoring the rest of the team as you see fit on all things technical.

What You Have


3+ years experience in an analytics and/or data-science related field (preferably within the e-commerce industry)
3+ years experience working with structured and unstructured data-sets as well as data extraction tools such as Hive and/or SQL
Solid understanding of testing and modelling statistics (R2, p-value, t-test etc…)
3+ year experience with statistical software such as R, or coding language: Python
3+ years Experience with Data Visualisation tools (like Tableau and PowerBI ideally)
Hands-on experience with setting up test studies: A/B tests, Geo-experimentation and Lift studies


Nice To Have


Advanced knowledge of Customer, Marketing Analytics and modelling such as price elasticity test and formula, Marketing Mix Models, LifeTime Value calculations etc…
Bachelor’s degree in Business, Statistics, Data Science, Economics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, Sociology or similar
Very advanced knowledge of Python or R


What We Offer


30 days of holiday, a great pension scheme and one of the best relocation packages in Amsterdam
Flexible working hours and an office overlooking the Amstel
Macbook Pro or Windows Laptop
Budget for noise-canceling headphones, travel to and from the office, working-from-home and self-learning
Free healthy breakfast, lunch and snacks by our in-house chef
Free Dutch classes to help out with daily life in the Netherlands
Regular parties, celebrations and other events


The process


Apply: Want in? Let us know! Apply for a role and help us get to know your best self.
Phone interview: One of our recruiters will get in touch to help you both understand if Recharge is the right next move for you.
First interview: You’ll meet with your future line manager (either in person or online) to talk about you, our culture and whether you're a fit for the job.
Assignment & Second interview: Some roles involve a case study. Great! It’s your chance to shine and show us you have what it takes. You’ll present your case study to the Hiring Manager and someone from the team
Third Interview: You’ll meet with a key member of the management team
Offer: You did it! There are only a few tickets available, and this one has your name on it. Welcome to the team.
Show more

  • Regular parties, celebrations and other events

  • Assignment & Second interview: Some roles involve a case study. Great! It’s your chance to shine and show us you have what it takes. You’ll present your case study to the Hiring Manager and someone from the team

Title: Data Scientist (f/m/d)
Description:
The target of vent.io is to accelerate the growth of German Mittelstand!




vent.io GmbH develops digital business models, products and services, collaborates with and invests in start-ups. We are a company of Deutsche Leasing AG and part of Sparkassen-Finanzgruppe.




We are looking for YOU as Data Scientist (f/m/d) in the division of Product Engineering.




YOUR TASKS

As a Data Scientist (w/m/d) you are part of the Data Science Team and develop Data Science Models for the business units:

You develop under the guidance of the senior data scientist(s) statistical and predictive models by using the Big Data analytics platform of vent.io
In close collaboration with the data engineers, you develop reusable components for data analysis, data aggregation and data products
You have an interest for new technologies, algorithms and technical concepts and find pleasure in evaluating those
You are enthusiastic about participating in meetup and external conferences for disseminating the successes of the team




YOUR SKILLS

Graduate degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Informatics or another quantitative field
Proven academic and/or professional track record in the areas of data analysis and predictive analytics
You understand NLP algorithms and know when to use them. Moreover, you know how to use models and solutions from the Gen-AI space and are confident applying them on the appropriate business challenges
Very good programming skills in Python
Very good use of SQL or SQL-like query languages
First experiences with cloud services around the topic of data management and processing
Good knowledge of at least one parallel data processing framework like Spark or Ray




YOUR COMPETENCIES

You have good analytical skills and you can split a complex problem down to its individual parts
Team work is not alien to you and you like working together with highly-skilled engineers and scientists
You bring perseverance and constructive assertiveness
You can speak English fluently and ideally have basic conversations in German




THIS IS WHAT WE OFFER

Flexible work options in the office space in Frankfurt am Main or in the context of mobile working
Free drinks and snacks in the vent.io office
Modern hardware that you can also use privately
Fitness budget, which you can manage yourself in the emplu app
Your future, our contribution: company pension scheme
Participation in vent.io internal events (offsite, kick-off, etc.)
Room for taking responsibility, quality, co-design and team spirit
Start-up flair with the security of the Sparkassen Finanzgruppe behind you




You have any questions? Write us an e-mail to jobs@vent.io

Or visit our website www. vent.io!

Show more

Title: AI Data Scientist, Utrecht
Description:
Sogeti is een organisatie met een goede werksfeer en zo min mogelijk hiërarchische verhoudingen. Ga je bij ons als AI Data Scientist aan de slag? Dan kun je rekenen op honderden collega’s die klaarstaan om klanten te helpen, en ook elkaar graag een helpende hand bieden. Sogetisten gaan niet alleen voor goede resultaten, maar ook voor lol tijdens het werk. Deze snelgroeiende groep collega’s krijgt energie van hun vak en dat merk je op de werkvloer. Sogeti is een fijne werkgever en geeft jou de ruimte om de inhoud in te duiken!

Werken bij Sogeti

Als Data Scientist help je onze klanten vertrouwd te maken met verwerken van complexe data door middel van machine learning, data mining en deep learning technologieën. Je zet statistische modellen en voorspellende algoritmes in om verborgen patronen te onthullen. Daarbij ontwikkel je end-tot-end oplossingen om je werk te operationaliseren. Dit doe je samen met het Center of Excellence (CoE) van ons AI-team, of in directe samenwerking met de klant. Je creëert echte impact door middel van data.

Wie ben jij?

✔ Je hebt een masterdiploma (WO) ;

✔ Je hebt minimaal drie jaar werkervaring als Data Scientist of consultant in het werkveld van Data Science. Veel werkervaring met EDA en Machine Learning (Classification, Regression, Computer Vision, NLP, GANs) is belangrijk;

✔ Implementeren van technologieën aan de hand van de data science stack van Python (Scikit-learn, Tensorflow, Pytorch, Pandas, Numpy)? Geen probleem! ;

✔ Programmeertalen als R, Scala, C++ en Bash? Vertel me iets nieuws!

✔ Je bent in de wolken van Cloudoplossingingen (Azure, AWS, GCP) én kan agile werken? Ja!

✔ Je wilt samen met je team onze klanten naar ‘The Next Level’ brengen!

﻿Currently we are specific looking for professionals who speak fluently Dutch on C1 level.

Dit bieden wij jou

✔ Top Notch begeleiding bij al jouw werkzaamheden, ontwikkelingsvraagstukken, ambitie en uitdagingen!

✔ Onbeperkt ontwikkelbudget;

✔ Aantrekkelijke lease regeling met hybride en volledig elektrische auto’s;

✔ 26 vakantiedagen (mogelijkheid tot extra bijkopen)

✔ Goede pensioensregeling

✔ Groeien en genieten. Wij zorgen voor een cultuur waarin jij tot je recht komt.

✔ Vette events zoals Pizza avonden, ski-trips, game nights, movie nights.

﻿Weet jij nog iets? The sky is the limit.

You make technology work. Solliciteer nu!

Dus durf jij de uitdaging aan en wil jij meehelpen het succes van onze community verder uit te bouwen? Solliciteer dan direct!

﻿Een PES-screening maakt onderdeel uit van de onboarding van Sogeti.

﻿﻿Currently we are specific looking for professionals who speak fluently Dutch on C1 level.

Title: Data scientist
Description:
Het ZOL is een supra regionaal topklinisch ziekenhuis dat zowel basiszorg als complexe zorg aanbiedt in Genk, Lanaken en Maaseik.

Heb jij een passie voor data? Een grote interesse in de medische wereld? Wil je werken met de laatste cloud-technologieën? Top! Wij willen ons data science team nogmaals uitbreiden. Misschien ben jij wel de nieuwe collega waar we naar op zoek zijn?

Je krijg de unieke kans om een FHIR omgeving uit te bouwen die de komende jaren een cruciale rol zal spelen in de wereld van de tele-geneeskunde en in data-uitwisselingen tussen ziekenhuizen. Daar nog niet mee vertrouwd? Geen probleem! Wij leren het samen met jou! We hebben verschillende projecten waarin je direct aan de slag kan.

Jij als data scientist


Je extraheert data uit verschillende elektronische bronnen in het ZOL en brengt deze samen binnen een datalake.
Je cleant en formatteert deze data om als kwalitatieve dataset ter beschikking te stellen voor zorgverleners, onderzoekers en management.
Je denkt inhoudelijk mee met gebruikers en onderzoekers over de wijze van vertaling naar data, dashboards en rapporten en bouwt hiervoor de nodige rapporteringtools.
Je werkt mee aan de technische uitbouw van de omgeving waarin het datateam werkt, met aandacht voor automatisering, monitoring en security.
Aan de hand van de nieuwste technologieën bouw je mee een state-of-the-art data- en kwaliteitsplatform uit.



Wat zijn jouw troeven?


Je hebt een master- of ingenieursdiploma in een ICT richting (burgerlijk ingenieur, computerwetenschappen/major informatica,...). Ook laatstejaarsstudenten mogen zich kandidaat stellen.
OF je hebt een masterdiploma in een wetenschappelijke richting met 2 jaar relevante IT ervaring.
Je hebt een zeer goede kennis van het Nederlands. (minimaal B2 level, indien niet moedertaal)



Wat kan je verwachten?


Je komt terecht in een team van echte experten, die met veel plezier jou zowel inhoudelijk als technisch ondersteunen. Het team maakt onderdeel uit van het departement ICT en kwaliteit. Je rapporteert aan het hoofd data science.
Je werkt in een topklinisch ziekenhuis dat inzet op groei en innovatie. We geven je de mogelijkheid om hierin je stempel te drukken.
Tewerkstellingspercentage: 100%.
Marktconforme verloning volgens IFIC ziekenhuisbarema’s in functie van relevante werkervaring Dit wordt aangevuld met vakantiegeld, een eindejaarspremie, maaltijdcheques (4 € ) en een groepsverzekering ( 3 % van het totale brutoloon) met bijdrage van werknemer en werkgever.
Extra verlofdag per maand o.w.v.de 40 uren week.
Extra vergoeding wanneer je met de fiets komt.



Bijkomende informatie

Inhoudelijk over de functie:


Noëlla Pierlet, hoofd data science (089/80 20 55 – noella.pierlet@zol.be)



Informatie over de selectieprocedure:


Kristof Van den Bergh, talent recruiter (089/80 36 50 – kristof.vandenbergh@zol.be)



De procedure omvat een selectiegesprek. Indien weerhouden volgt er een assessment.

Interesse? ’t ZOL wel zijn!

Solliciteren kan via de knop ‘solliciteer dan hier’.

Deadline kandidaatstelling: tot de vacature is ingevuld.

Externe consultants komen niet in aanmerking.

Deze functie is voorzien voor 2 jaar.

Toegevoegd aan je sollicitatie ontvangen we graag je cv, diploma en motivatiebrief.
Show more

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Sia Partners is a specialist Management Consulting firm created in 1999 and has grown into a global firm with approximately 2800 employees and annual revenue exceeding $400m. Our culture is strongly orientated towards high-quality expertise and delivering excellent results and outcomes for our clients, which include a wide range of multinational companies. Our global presence and our expertise in more than 40 sectors and services allows us to accompany clients worldwide. Using innovative technologies such as our own in-house apps, social networks, and digital tools, we provide a truly integrated global service.



Through Consulting for Good, we put our expertise at the service of our clients' climate objectives and make sustainable development a performance lever for our clients. Our portfolio of offerings is cross-sectors and 17 % of our revenue is generated from engagements with a CSR focus.






Job Description



What you will do
As an expert in the field of Machine Learning Engineering you will be responsible for the growth of our Data team, both professionally as well as in size. You will be in charge of shaping and executing the future of your expertise within Sia Partners. You will work on client projects as well as on building our own Sia AI solutions, together with our Dutch team of Data Scientists, our French Data Engineering team, and other business units of Sia Partners Global.



Your responsibilities include:



Leading an internal team towards the development of AI products;
Working in a multidisciplinary team on client projects as an expert on your subject;
Making architectural and design decisions for cloud environments;
Building production level ML/AI solutions with solid software engineering;
Guiding Data Scientists to scale up their models into production (parallelizing, optimizing, tuning, testing, and wrapping);
Giving trainings, leading internal meetings and organizing external events;
Participating in team meetings and workshops with clients;
Writing blog articles, presenting at conferences and sending out press releases on the subject that you lead.

Who you will work with
The Data Science team is young, diverse and growing (10+). You will join a team that will challenge you and invest in your professional development. We have a flat structure and rely on the entrepreneurial spirit of our members: initiative is highly encouraged. We are striving for well-being, diversity and knowledge-sharing inside the team, so that we can grow together.



Who you are



You are an established technical professional that wants to make the next step in their career, taking on more leadership responsibilities.
You have first-rate project management and time management skills.
You are a true problem solver, you turn complex issues into simple and impactful business solutions.
You are enthusiastic for applying Data Science/Engineering solutions to business problems.
You have excellent communication skills and can present complicated concepts in a synthetic way.
You have the ability to adapt rapidly and work on a range of different business areas within a challenging environment.
You have the ability to work collaboratively in a team environment.

In return, you can expect:



An international company that gives importance to diversity, inclusion, employee well-being and corporate social responsibilities actions.
A great working atmosphere with friendly and professional colleagues where innovation and entrepreneurship are encouraged
A personal development plan with a regular follow-up as well training opportunities to develop yourself
A competitive salary with great advantages, like mobility budget, hospital insurance, performance -related bonus,...


Qualifications







MSc level education in Computer Science, Applied Mathematics, Artificial Intelligence, Embedded Systems or related field of study.
2-4 years of experience in building production-quality ML/Deep Learning pipelines and models.
Good understanding of Machine Learning fundamentals and strong knowledge in a specific domain (e.g., Computer Vision, Deep Learning, NLP).
Expert coding skills in Python and at least one of these languages: Scala, C++, Java.
Hands-on experience with database management languages (e.g., SQL, PostgreSQL).
Hands-on experience in cloud-based infrastructures (AWS/GCP/Azure).
Hands-on experience with Unix-based command line and DevOps tools (Git, Docker, Kubernetes).
Hands-on experience with big data technologies (e.g. Spark, Hadoop, Databricks).
Experience with coaching/mentoring other engineers.
Prior experience in Management Consulting is a strong plus.
Willingness to travel and work at local and international clients.
Fluency in spoken and written English is required.
Ability or strong willingness to be professionally proficient in the Dutch language.


Additional Information



We are unable to provide a work permit for this position



Sia Partners is an equal opportunity employer. All aspects of employment, including hiring, promotion, remuneration, or discipline, are based solely on performance, competence, conduct, or business needs.

  • Experience with coaching/mentoring other engineers.
  • Prior experience in Management Consulting is a strong plus.

  • Fluency in spoken and written English is required.

Title: (Junior) Data Scientist (m/f/d)
Description:
Excited about AI?

Join us at ZDF Sparks and be part of an exciting journey in AI innovation! We are looking for a full-time (Junior) Data Scientist (m/f/d) for our location in Berlin in a hybrid set-up at the earliest possible starting date.

Your Role

Work with the senior data science and ML teams with


design, review, implementation and modernization of data systems, solutions and algorithms from data analytics to advanced AI/ML solutions 
Work with structured and unstructured data, their preprocessing and visualization
Help to train new models for various use cases from POC to production 
Work on solutions across multiple media formats such as text, image, audio and video
Open source algorithms and make AI explainable for larger audiences


Your Profile


Basic skills in Python, including data manipulation and analysis with pandas and NumPy, and data visualization using Matplotlib and Seaborn.
Basic knowledge of machine learning libraries such as scikit-learn, and experience with Jupyter Notebooks and LangChain or similar libraries.
Hands-on experience in data analytics, visualization, and pre-processing tasks.
Initial experience or strong interest in designing and implementing algorithms and building generative AI applications.
Strong interest in working at the intersection of consultancy business and technology, and in learning advanced data modeling skills.
Excellent communication skills in English and preferably in German, to effectively interact with team members, stakeholders, and clients.


Our Commitment To You

ZDF Sparks is a workplace for curious, ambitious, and collaborative AI trendsetters who are excited about working on new and continuously changing customer challenges. We proudly embrace diversity and enjoy working in fast-paced cross-functional and multicultural teams.

Our hybrid office and mobile work model is designed to support personal flexibility and creativity, enabling a healthy work-life balance. We offer flexible working hours and a hybrid setup to accommodate any personal circumstances. In our centrally located Berlin top-floor office, we enjoy modern spaces with ergonomic workstations grouped to facilitate personal exchange and knowledge sharing, as well as closed rooms for larger meetings and quiet work.

We network with our ZDF office partners and visitors over lunches, talks, and afterwork get-together events; and engage in fun team activities during regular company events.

To support your professional growth, we offer opportunities for further education through (external) regular workshops and hackathons, and networking events. Additionally, we provide a professional development budget (per employee) for conferences, certifications, or external courses. The 30-day vacation rounds up the year to relax off the job.

Our Values

At ZDF Sparks, our values are the cornerstone of everything we do:


Transparent: We believe in clear, open communication both within our team and with our clients. Your insights and knowledge will be valued and shared to drive collective success.
Fun: We believe that work should be enjoyable and fulfilling. At ZDF Sparks, we maintain a light-hearted atmosphere with humor and a relaxed communication style among colleagues. This fosters a positive environment where everyone feels comfortable and motivated to contribute their best, ensuring our collaborative efforts are both productive and enjoyable.
Diverse: Our strength lies in our diverse team. Different perspectives and backgrounds drive our creativity and innovation, ensuring that our AI solutions are comprehensive and inclusive. By integrating different points of view, our collaborative team develops AI that reflects various experiences and meets the diverse needs of our clients.
Innovative: We live and breathe innovation, continuously learning and pushing boundaries to deliver cutting-edge AI solutions.


Any Questions?

Your contact person is: Nilofer Qayumi (Senior Technical Recruiter)

For any questions about the job advertisement and the application process, please contact career@zdf-sparks.com.

We look forward to getting to know you!

At ZDF Sparks, diversity drives our innovation and strengthens our team. We are committed to creating an inclusive environment where every individual feels valued and respected. We welcome applications from all qualified candidates, regardless of race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, age, national origin, disability, or any other legally protected status.

About Us

ZDF Sparks was founded in 2024 - our data experts are an agile team dedicated to the development of AI solutions and algorithms for the media industry. We are focused on consulting, design and implementation of AI services, especially in the areas of algorithms, machine learning and data platforms for planning, communication, distribution and personalization of data and audiovisual content.

We are the perfect place for curious, ambitious and collaborative AI trendsetters who are excited about working on new and changing challenges. We enjoy working in our fast-paced, cross-functional and diverse team where everyone feels comfortable and can fulfill their full potential.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Monthly gross salary: 13000 - 16000 PLN.




Do you have a passion for machine learning and a strong desire to turn data into actionable insights? Are you eager to learn and contribute to real-world projects? If so, we want to hear from you!




About us:

DataPhant is a startup based in Switzerland. Our mission is to help other companies become as efficient as possible using Artificial Intelligence. We build custom AI models, fine-tune Large Language Models, build chatbots as well as AI-powered data analysis pipelines helping customers achieve their peak productivity.




About the Role:

We are seeking a talented and motivated Data Analyst / Machine Learning Engineer to join our growing team. In this role, you will play a key part in the development and implementation of machine learning models to solve complex business problems. You will work closely with software engineers and product managers to translate use cases into technical tasks, prepare data for analysis, design and implement machine learning models, engineer prompts for Large Language Models (LLMs) and document your work for future reference.




Responsibilities:

● Collaborate with stakeholders to understand proposed use cases and translate them into actionable tasks for machine learning projects.

● Analyze and prepare data for modeling, including identifying proofs of concept (PoCs).

● Design and implement machine learning models, iteratively refining them to meet customer satisfaction.

● Build automated data pipelines to ingest and process structured and unstructured data from various sources.

● Document both the implemented machine learning models and data pipelines for clarity and future reference.




Recommended Background:

● You are a self-starter and are able to work with minimal supervision.

● Experience with deep learning, natural language processing (NLP) and/or LLMs.

● Degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, or a related field, or equivalent practical experience.

● 3-6 years of experience in a similar role.

● Experience with software development in one or more programming languages (including Python).

● Experience with data analysis, data cleaning, LLM prompting and model development.

● Experience with database languages like SQL and commonly used Python libraries like Pandas and TensorFlow.

● Fluency in English.




This is a hybrid location position: you are required to work 2-3 days a week from the office in either Kraków, Wrocław or Gdańsk.

We offer a 12-months temporary contract with the possibility of extending it or converting to a permanent contract.




If you are ready to take your machine learning skills to the next level, we encourage you to apply!

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Machine Learning Engineer - Utrecht Omgeving - Retail - Fulltime




Breng dit data team naar een hoger niveau met je expertise in ML/AI! en jij een expert in het benutten van AI/ML en kun je Data Scientists helpen bij het ontwikkelen en onderhouden van productieklare modellen? Als ML Engineer ben je onderdeel van het data analytics team voor een grote retailer in Nederland. Jij bent de specialist in MLOps en Cloud Computing, verantwoordelijk voor het productieklaar maken van AI/ML-oplossingen. Hiermee sla je de brug tussen de Data Scientists en de technologie (Azure/Databricks). Samen met je collega's (data scientists, consultants, analisten en engineers) werk je aan uiteenlopende projecten op het gebied van forecasting, logistiek, assortimentsoptimalisatie, e-commerce en CRM.




Werkzaamheden:




Je werkt samen met het Data Science-team om sterke AI/ML-modellen te creëren, waarbij je zorgt voor grondige monitoring van de proces-, data- en modelkwaliteit om fouten en verkeerde voorspellingen te voorkomen.
Je biedt advies en oplossingen voor technische uitdagingen die zich tijdens het ontwikkelingsproces voordoen.
Als specialist in MLOps en CI/CD onderhoud en verbeter je continu de modellen.
Je fungeert als verbindingspersoon tussen Data Science en Global IT voor het gebruik van technologieën zoals Databricks en Azure, die door Global IT worden beheerd.
Je draagt actief bij aan de vooruitgang van technologie en tools door het ontwikkelen van utility packages en het verder ontwikkelen van MLOps-methodologie.
Je blijft op de hoogte van innovaties binnen MLOps en bepaalt hoe deze kunnen bijdragen aan de doelen.







Wat zit erin voor jou?




Een dynamische omgeving waarin je veel kunt leren en plezier hebt door verantwoordelijkheid, vrijheid en ruimte voor persoonlijke ontwikkeling.
Een competitief salaris, afhankelijk van jouw ervaring en opleiding
24 vakantiedagen en extra dagen op fulltime basis.
Mogelijkheid tot 19 extra vakantiedagen + mogelijkheid tot kopen of verkopen van vakantiedagen
Korting bij de retailer zelf
Leer- en doorgroeimogelijkheden met een interne academy.
2-3 dagen per week vanuit huis kunnen werken, flexibele uren
Kilometer vergoeding voor reis naar het kantoor.




Wie ben jij?

3+ jaar ervaring als ML Engineer of Data Scientist met affiniteit voor ML
Expertise in Python, PySpark en SQL
Ervaring met MLOps/ CI/CD cyclus en Git
Werken in scrumteams
Kennis van Databricks en Azure
Teamspirit en kunnen sparren met je collega's om zo mogelijke oplossingen voor te leggen.
Vloeiend in Nederlands en Engels




Ben jij de juiste fit? Neem nu contact op :)

Show more
HTML:
Machine Learning Engineer - Utrecht Omgeving - Retail - Fulltime


Breng dit data team naar een hoger niveau met je expertise in ML/AI! en jij een expert in het benutten van AI/ML en kun je Data Scientists helpen bij het ontwikkelen en onderhouden van productieklare modellen? Als ML Engineer ben je onderdeel van het data analytics team voor een grote retailer in Nederland. Jij bent de specialist in MLOps en Cloud Computing, verantwoordelijk voor het productieklaar maken van AI/ML-oplossingen. Hiermee sla je de brug tussen de Data Scientists en de technologie (Azure/Databricks). Samen met je collega's (data scientists, consultants, analisten en engineers) werk je aan uiteenlopende projecten op het gebied van forecasting, logistiek, assortimentsoptimalisatie, e-commerce en CRM.


Werkzaamheden:


  • Je werkt samen met het Data Science-team om sterke AI/ML-modellen te creëren, waarbij je zorgt voor grondige monitoring van de proces-, data- en modelkwaliteit om fouten en verkeerde voorspellingen te voorkomen.
  • Je biedt advies en oplossingen voor technische uitdagingen die zich tijdens het ontwikkelingsproces voordoen.
  • Als specialist in MLOps en CI/CD onderhoud en verbeter je continu de modellen.
  • Je fungeert als verbindingspersoon tussen Data Science en Global IT voor het gebruik van technologieën zoals Databricks en Azure, die door Global IT worden beheerd.
  • Je draagt actief bij aan de vooruitgang van technologie en tools door het ontwikkelen van utility packages en het verder ontwikkelen van MLOps-methodologie.
  • Je blijft op de hoogte van innovaties binnen MLOps en bepaalt hoe deze kunnen bijdragen aan de doelen.



Wat zit erin voor jou?


  • Een dynamische omgeving waarin je veel kunt leren en plezier hebt door verantwoordelijkheid, vrijheid en ruimte voor persoonlijke ontwikkeling.
  • Een competitief salaris, afhankelijk van jouw ervaring en opleiding
  • 24 vakantiedagen en extra dagen op fulltime basis.
  • Mogelijkheid tot 19 extra vakantiedagen + mogelijkheid tot kopen of verkopen van vakantiedagen
  • Korting bij de retailer zelf
  • Leer- en doorgroeimogelijkheden met een interne academy.
  • 2-3 dagen per week vanuit huis kunnen werken, flexibele uren
  • Kilometer vergoeding voor reis naar het kantoor.


Wie ben jij?

  • 3+ jaar ervaring als ML Engineer of Data Scientist met affiniteit voor ML
  • Expertise in Python, PySpark en SQL
  • Ervaring met MLOps/ CI/CD cyclus en Git
  • Werken in scrumteams
  • Kennis van Databricks en Azure
  • Teamspirit en kunnen sparren met je collega's om zo mogelijke oplossingen voor te leggen.
  • Vloeiend in Nederlands en Engels


Ben jij de juiste fit? Neem nu contact op :)

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Docsity is an educational community where millions of university students share and find study content to improve their exam preparation. Our mission is to help students to be more effective in their preparation, and connect them with meaningful learning opportunities.




We are managing this recruitment process in collaboration with one of our strategic partner companies, who are looking for talented individuals to join their team.




The ideal candidate's favorite words are learning, data, scale, and agility. You will leverage your strong collaboration skills and ability to extract valuable insights from highly complex data sets to ask the right questions and find the right answers.




About the role:

You will collaborate closely with interdisciplinary teams to design and implement advanced AI solutions that drive decision-making and innovation. Your daily activities will include:

Analyze raw data: assessing quality, cleansing, and structuring for downstream processing
Develop architectures to streamline data science processes
Support initiatives for data integrity and normalization
Promote data-based decision-making across the company through reports and presentations
Develop insightful dashboards to track performances




Requirements:

Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience in a quantitative field (Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, etc.)
Great analytical skills and attention to detail, insights-driven attitude
Fluency in Python, Pandas, and database technology (SQL, schema design and query optimization techniques)
Expertise in using BI tools (e.g. Looker, Looker Data Studio, Tableau, AWS QuickSight)
Understanding of full software development life cycle and agile development
Proficiency in Italian (B2+)




Nice to have

experience in Large Language Models APIs or quantitative analytics or data modeling is a plus
Expertise in using BI tools (e.g. Looker, Looker Data Studio, Tableau, AWS QuickSight)
Experience on Ecommerce and digital marketing metrics
Expertise in using scalable analytics techniques (e.g., PySpark, Dask, Modin, Koalas) and MPP databases (e.g., BigQuery, Redshift, Snowflake) for complex data assembly and transformation




What’s in it for you?

Work with tons of data, to which you will have full access
Work closely with all functions within the organization
You’ll have the unique chance to work on high-impact Data/AI projects within a large-scale organization where your contributions will drive tangible change
Work in a highly-skilled, organized and cross-functional Data Team
Opportunity to grow personally and professionally through training and peer interaction
Hybrid work structure: 4 days in the office and 1 day of smart working per week.
Show more

Title: MACHINE LEARNING ENGINEER
Description:
NDT Global is the leading provider of ultra-high-tech diagnostic inspection solutions, advanced data analysis and integrity assessment services for ensuring the safety and longevity of energy-sector infrastructure assets. Recognized as the forerunner in ultrasonic inspection technologies comprising Pulse Echo, Pitch-and-Catch and Phased Array, as well as Acoustic Resonance (ART Scan) methodologies, the company also deploys a range of non-ultrasonic technologies, such as Inertial Measurement Units, with more under development. NDT Global strategically applies its inspection technologies to detect, diagnose and model various types of threat—circumferential or axial cracks, metal loss, geometry, mapping, and more—across diverse classes of assets. By providing predictive, decision-ready insights driven by the world’s most accurate data, NDT Global enables the conditions for asset owners to optimize infrastructure health and drive operational efficiencies while reducing risk and minimizing their carbon footprint




Purpose

The goal of the Machine Learning Engineer is to introduce new solutions based on machine learning, especially deep learning, to improve accuracy and efficiency of data analysis from data preparation, model training and testing to deployment in a productive environment.




Tasks

Applies supervised techniques, mostly deep learning techniques, for solving pattern recognition problems in ultrasound data (images, signals)
Understands and interprets data to come up with optimal feature sets
Prepares datasets to train and validate models
Ensures quality of the developed prototypes by software testing and code reviews
Writes documentation of developed solutions and ensures knowledge transfer




Requirements

Bachelor’s or master's degree in computer science or a related field (PhD preferred)
Relevant work experience more than 1 year, in machine learning, deep learning or similar
Experience working on end-to-end ML projects, from data collection to production-level deployment
Experience with image recognition, object detection, and other computer vision tasks.
Proficiency in Python, TensorFlow/PyTorch, and data manipulation libraries
Be able to read SQL databases
Familiarity with big data tools like Apache Spark for data manipulation is a plus.
Experience with git, git workflows, or contribution on git hub is preferred
Must be proficient in spoken and written English




Benefits

Competitive salary and comprehensive benefits package: Health Insurance, pension Plan, Gym Flex, eyecare, 23 days Annual leave
Flexible & Hybrid working: Our flextime model allows you to design your working day as it suits your needs
We think about the future: Individual training and development opportunities and professional development schemes
Opportunity to work with cutting-edge technologies and make a significant impact on our data strategy
International, intercultural and young working environment.
Great company culture and office environment
Show more

Title: ML / AI Engineer (m/w/d)
Description:
Du brennst für Themen wie AI, Machine Learning und KI-Agenten? Du hast Spaß daran, innovative Lösungen mitzugestalten und als zentrale Schnittstelle zwischen unseren internen Projektteams, Kunden und Sales zu agieren? Als ML Engineer (m/w/d) entwickelst du neue Features, treibst technische Themen aktiv voran und wirkst strategisch an der Ausrichtung und Weiterentwicklung von shopfloorGPT mit – inklusive dem Einsatz von KI-Agenten zur Automatisierung komplexer Abläufe. Klingt spannend? Dann bewirb dich jetzt und werde Teil unseres Teams! 🚀

Dein Profil

Du hast ein abgeschlossenes Studium in Informatik, Software Engineering oder eine vergleichbare Qualifikation.

Du besitzt eine hohe Kommunikationsfähigkeit und kannst komplexe technische Konzepte, wie den Einsatz von KI-Agenten, auch einer non-tech Audience verständlich vermitteln.

Du bringst eine pragmatische, lösungsorientierte Denkweise mit, die dir hilft, auch in stressigen Projektphasen den Überblick zu behalten und das Team zu motivieren.

Du schätzt die enge Zusammenarbeit mit Kunden und internen Teams und zeichnest dich durch eine starke Kundenorientierung aus.

Du hast fundierte Erfahrung in der Softwareentwicklung (Python, Node.js, TypeScript, JavaScript) sowie in der Arbeit an AI-/ML-Projekten und ein großes Interesse an aktuellen Entwicklungen, insbesondere im Bereich KI-Agenten.

Deine Aufgaben

Technische Beratung & Konzeption: Du berätst unsere Kunden zur Umsetzung AI-basierter Lösungen mit shopfloorGPT und unterstützt sie beim Einsatz von KI-Agenten zur Automatisierung komplexer Abläufe.

Feature-Entwicklung: Du entwickelst neue Machine-Learning- und NLP-Features, die Prozesslücken durch KI-Agenten schließen und echten Mehrwert schaffen.

Prototyping & Implementierung: Du erstellst Prototypen, um Kundenanforderungen schnell zu validieren und KI-Lösungen vorzustellen.

Technisches Consulting: Du unterstützt den Vertrieb mit verständlichen technischen Inhalten und fungierst als Experte in Sales Calls, Demos und Konzepten.

Team Enablement: Du erklärst komplexe Themen wie KI-Agenten für unsere internen Teams und stehst bei Rückfragen zur Verfügung.

Strategie & Planung: Du bringst deine Expertise in die Roadmap und strategische Ausrichtung ein, koordinierst Teamaufgaben und stellst reibungslose Abläufe sicher.
Show more

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Intercom was founded in 2011 to change the standard of customer service online. Our AI-first customer service platform is a totally new way to deliver customer service and is designed to transform the way businesses interact with their customers through AI. We all know that customer service on the internet sucks. It’s slow and impersonal. We help businesses provide instant and exceptional service to their customers and maximize their support agents’ productivity, efficiency, and performance—all through our single AI system. More than 25,000 businesses use Intercom to send millions of messages to millions of customers each month.Intercom has been a long-standing product leader and cultural icon in the technology and startup worlds for more than a decade. We set the pace for our industry and live by our values that allow us to push boundaries, build with speed and intensity, and deliver incredible value to our customers.Join us on our mission to redefine customer service and make internet business personal.

What's the opportunity? 🤔

At Intercom, the Finance Analytics teammate partners with Finance, Product, GTM, and Data Engineering teams in order to identify, report and generate insights relating to Intercom’s ARR. We're looking for highly quantitative individuals who are passionate about transforming data into actionable insights and communicating them boldly. We're seeking like-minded people who are constantly curious, eager to deepen their understanding of our business, and committed to driving value.

In this role, you will leverage large datasets and develop expert systems to enhance both our processes and our understanding of business performance. You’ll work closely with Finance leadership and teams to gain business context, brainstorm ideas, and deliver meaningful insights. We’re looking for someone who not only excels in analytics but also proactively surfaces recommendations, manages competing priorities across multiple stakeholders, and works across the analytics and data stack to tackle complex problems.

Here are examples of some projects you might work on:


Drivers of revenue for existing customers
Impact of new pricing and packaging strategies
Robust and comprehensive monthly reports for executive stakeholders


If you're someone who thrives in a data-driven environment and enjoys uncovering insights that shape business decisions, we would love to hear from you!

What will I be doing? 🚀


You’ll partner with both internal FP&A teams to help them identify important questions about ARR performance and answer those questions with data
You’ll work closely with finance, product and GTM partners to objectively measure business performance, develop / refine core metrics and create reporting to understand and monitor them
You’ll design and build end-to-end data pipelines, working closely with stakeholders to drive the collection of new data and the refinement and iteration of existing data sources and data tools
You’ll craft data stories and share your findings and recommendations across FP&A and the broader company
You’ll build and automate actionable models and dashboards
You’ll obsess over data quality
Conduct ad-hoc analysis to help solve real time and strategic business questions


What skills do I need? 📖


4+ years experience working with data to solve problems and drive evidence-based decisions
Excellent SQL skills and good knowledge of statistics
Excellent communication skills (technical and non-technical) and a focus on driving impact and influencing change
A humble overachiever. You are laser-focused on driving positive business outcomes for customers
Strong growth mindset and sense of ownership. Innate passion and curiosity
Advanced Proficiency with BI/Visualization tools like Tableau, Superset or Looker


Bonus skills & attributes 🙌


Experience with a scientific computing language (such as R or Python)
Experience with data modeling and ETL pipelines
Experience working with product / GTM teams


Benefits 😍

We are a well-treated bunch, with awesome benefits! If there’s something important to you that’s not on this list, talk to us! :)


Competitive salary and equity in a fast-growing start-up
We serve lunch every weekday, plus a variety of snack foods and a fully stocked kitchen
Regular compensation reviews - we reward great work!
Pension scheme & match up to 4%
Peace of mind with life assurance, as well as comprehensive health and dental insurance for you and your dependents
Flexible paid time off policy
Paid maternity leave, as well as 6 weeks paternity leave for fathers, to let you spend valuable time with your loved ones
If you’re cycling, we’ve got you covered on the Cycle-to-Work Scheme. With secure bike storage too
MacBooks are our standard, but we’re happy to get you whatever equipment helps you get your job done


Policies

Intercom has a hybrid working policy. We believe that working in person helps us stay connected, collaborate easier and create a great culture while still providing flexibility to work from home. We expect employees to be in the office at least two days per week.

We have a radically open and accepting culture at Intercom. We avoid spending time on divisive subjects to foster a safe and cohesive work environment for everyone. As an organization, our policy is to not advocate on behalf of the company or our employees on any social or political topics out of our internal or external communications. We respect personal opinion and expression on these topics on personal social platforms on personal time, and do not challenge or confront anyone for their views on non-work related topics. Our goal is to focus on doing incredible work to achieve our goals and unite the company through our core values.

Intercom values diversity and is committed to a policy of Equal Employment Opportunity. Intercom will not discriminate against an applicant or employee on the basis of race, color, religion, creed, national origin, ancestry, sex, gender, age, physical or mental disability, veteran or military status, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, marital status, or any other legally recognized protected basis under federal, state, or local law.

Is this role not quite what you're looking for? Join our Talent Community to stay connected with us.
Show more
